## Class 2: January 19, 2016
## Native / Web app review * What do you like/dislike about each? * Does one have more/different features than the other? * Which is easier to use, navigate? * Is one faster, more responsive?
## Idea pitch format * 2 minutes max * Describe your app idea * Who is your app for? * List 1 main feature * Class 5 Thursday, Jan 28th
## Data formats
### Text ``` First Last Address Rob Wisner 123 Main Street ```
### CSV Comma Separated Values ```csv "First","Last","Address" "Rob","Wisner","123 Main Street" ```
### XML eXtensible Markup Language ```xml <person> <first>First</first> <last>Last</last> <address>Address</address> </person> <person> <first>Rob</first> <last>Wisner</last> <address>123 Main Street</address> </person> ```
### JSON Javascript Object Notation ```json { "person": [{ "first": "First", "last": "Last", "address": "Address" }, { "first": "Rob", "last": "Wisner", "address": "123 Main Street" }] } ```
## Hosting * Develop and test locally * Deploy code to hosting server
## Cloud 9 * Hosted development environment * File browser * Code editor * Web server
* Create Cloud 9 account * Create a workspace named "assignments" * Share workspace * "michaelmckisson" * "rwisner" * Create a new file called index.html * Type in HTML * Run with Apache * Test it in your browser
